duties_responsibilities.duty: Greet clients and patients, obtain weight and vital signs, and record medical records.
Assist doctors with appointments, surgery, dentistry, and euthanasia.
Schedule appointments, provide client education, relay test results, and maintain client/patient records.
Prepare patients for surgical and dental procedures, assist in anesthetizing patients, and monitor patients during recovery.
Perform in-hospital treatments for sick patients, including administering medications and fluid therapy.
Assist in the training of new staff members and general dissemination of knowledge as required.
Maintain hospital environment cleanliness and perform regular cleaning based on a maintenance schedule.

education_certification.credential: Preferred to have at least 1-year previous experience working in veterinary practice or sufficient relatable animal care experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Compassionate and sympathetic, and maintain a professional attitude and demeanor during emotional and stressful situations.
Willingness to learn new techniques and treatments, offer creative ideas, and accept change.
